intro: Sisyrinchium aurantiacum, commonly known as the golden blue-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Iridaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers with a blue-centered bloom. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, delicate flowers that bloom in early summer. Sisyrinchium aurantiacum is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to dry, arid conditions.
